description.content:
Returns a list of messages based on query parameters.

**Rate Limit:** This endpoint is rate limited to 3500 requests per 5 minutes per Source IP address. Exceeding the limit returns HTTP 429 with a `Retry-After` header.

The ID of the message to search for. Special characters need to be encoded using URL encoding. Message IDs could come in different formats, e.g., 9e0df4ca-b18d-40d7-a59f-82fcdf5ae8e6 and 1589228074636lm4k2je7j7jklbn2 are valid message ID formats. Note that you must include at least one query parameter.

The phone number that sent the message. Accepted values are: a single full phone number a comma separated list of full phone numbers (maximum of 10) or a single partial phone number (minimum of 5 characters e.g. '%2B1919').

The phone number that received the message. Accepted values are: a single full phone number a comma separated list of full phone numbers (maximum of 10) or a single partial phone number (minimum of 5 characters e.g. '%2B1919').
The status of the message. One of RECEIVED QUEUED SENDING SENT FAILED DELIVERED ACCEPTED UNDELIVERED. (This can only be one of RECEIVED,QUEUED,SENDING,SENT,FAILED,DELIVERED,ACCEPTED,UNDELIVERED)
The direction of the message. One of INBOUND OUTBOUND. (This can only be one of INBOUND,OUTBOUND)

The name of the carrier used for this message. Possible values include but are not limited to Verizon and TMobile. Special characters need to be encoded using URL encoding (i.e. AT&T should be passed as AT%26T).
The type of message. Either sms or mms. (This can only be one of sms,mms,rcs)
The error code of the message.
The start of the date range to search in ISO 8601 format. Uses the message receive time. The date range to search in is currently 14 days.
The end of the date range to search in ISO 8601 format. Uses the message receive time. The date range to search in is currently 14 days.
The campaign ID of the message.
The minimum Bandwidth latency of the message in seconds. Only available for accounts with the Advanced Quality Metrics feature enabled.
A boolean value indicating whether the message is queued in the Bandwidth network.
Messaging product associated with the message. (This can only be one of LOCAL_A2P,P2P,SHORT_CODE_REACH,TOLL_FREE,HOSTED_SHORT_CODE,ALPHA_NUMERIC,RBM_MEDIA,RBM_RICH,RBM_CONVERSATIONAL)
Location Id associated with the message.
A boolean value indicating whether the message is queued in the carrier network. Only available for OUTBOUND messages from accounts with the Advanced Quality Metrics feature enabled.
The minimum carrier latency of the message in seconds. Only available for OUTBOUND messages from accounts with the Advanced Quality Metrics feature enabled.
Calling number country in A3 format.
Called number country in A3 format.
The field and direction to sort by combined with a colon. Direction is either asc or desc.
A base64 encoded value used for pagination of results.
The maximum records requested in search result. Default 100. The sum of limit and after cannot be more than 10000.

When set to true, the response's totalCount field will have a maximum value of 10,000. When set to false, or excluded, this will give an accurate totalCount of all messages that match the provided filters. If you are experiencing latency, try using this parameter to limit your results.

The phone number that sent the message. Accepted values are: a single full phone number a comma separated list of full phone numbers (maximum of 10) or a single partial phone number (minimum of 5 characters e.g. '%2B1919').

The phone number that received the message. Accepted values are: a single full phone number a comma separated list of full phone numbers (maximum of 10) or a single partial phone number (minimum of 5 characters e.g. '%2B1919').
The status of the message. One of RECEIVED QUEUED SENDING SENT FAILED DELIVERED ACCEPTED UNDELIVERED. (This can only be one of RECEIVED,QUEUED,SENDING,SENT,FAILED,DELIVERED,ACCEPTED,UNDELIVERED)
The direction of the message. One of INBOUND OUTBOUND. (This can only be one of INBOUND,OUTBOUND)

The name of the carrier used for this message. Possible values include but are not limited to Verizon and TMobile. Special characters need to be encoded using URL encoding (i.e. AT&T should be passed as AT%26T).
The type of message. Either sms or mms. (This can only be one of sms,mms,rcs)

description.content:
Returns a max of 1000 conferences, sorted by `createdTime` from oldest to newest.

**NOTE:** If the number of conferences in the account is bigger than `pageSize`, a `Link` header (with format `<{url}>; rel="next"`) will be returned in the response. The url can be used to retrieve the next page of conference records.
Filter results to conferences which have a `createdTime` after or at `minCreatedTime` (in ISO8601 format).
Filter results to conferences which have a `createdTime` before or at `maxCreatedTime` (in ISO8601 format).
Specifies the max number of conferences that will be returned.
Not intended for explicit use. To use pagination, follow the links in the `Link` header of the response, as indicated in the endpoint description.

description.content: Added as a part of security scheme: basic

Downloads the specified transcription.
If the recording was multi-channel, then there will be 2 transcripts.
The caller/called party transcript will be the first item while [`<PlayAudio>`](/docs/voice/bxml/playAudio) and [`<SpeakSentence>`](/docs/voice/bxml/speakSentence) transcript will be the second item.
During a [`<Transfer>`](/docs/voice/bxml/transfer) the A-leg transcript will be the first item while the B-leg transcript will be the second item.
